trans-unit.source: Creating an Export Job
trans-unit.target: Creating an Export Job

trans-unit.source: Creating an export job for the Microsoft Azure Import/Export service using the REST API involves the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Creating an export job for the Microsoft Azure Import/Export service using the REST API involves the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Selecting the blobs to export.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the blobs to export.

trans-unit.source: Obtaining a shipping location.
trans-unit.target: Obtaining a shipping location.

trans-unit.source: Creating the export job.
trans-unit.target: Creating the export job.

trans-unit.source: Shipping your empty drives to Microsoft via a supported carrier service.
trans-unit.target: Shipping your empty drives to Microsoft via a supported carrier service.

trans-unit.source: Updating the export job with the package information.
trans-unit.target: Updating the export job with the package information.

trans-unit.source: Receiving the drives back from Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Receiving the drives back from Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Using the Windows Azure Import/Export Service to Transfer Data to Blob Storage</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=329852%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink> for an overview of the Import/Export service and a tutorial that demonstrates how to use the <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink> to create and manage import and export jobs.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Using the Windows Azure Import/Export Service to Transfer Data to Blob Storage</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=329852%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink> for an overview of the Import/Export service and a tutorial that demonstrates how to use the <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink> to create and manage import and export jobs.

trans-unit.source: Selecting Blobs to Export
trans-unit.target: Selecting Blobs to Export

trans-unit.source: To create an export job, you will need to provide a list of blobs that you want to export from your storage account.
trans-unit.target: To create an export job, you will need to provide a list of blobs that you want to export from your storage account.

trans-unit.source: There are a few ways to select blobs to be exported:
trans-unit.target: There are a few ways to select blobs to be exported:

trans-unit.source: You can use a relative blob path to select a single blob and all of its snapshots.
trans-unit.target: You can use a relative blob path to select a single blob and all of its snapshots.

trans-unit.source: You can use a relative blob path to select a single blob excluding its snapshots.
trans-unit.target: You can use a relative blob path to select a single blob excluding its snapshots.

trans-unit.source: You can use a relative blob path and a snapshot time to select a single snapshot.
trans-unit.target: You can use a relative blob path and a snapshot time to select a single snapshot.

trans-unit.source: You can use a blob prefix to select all blobs and snapshots with the given prefix.
trans-unit.target: You can use a blob prefix to select all blobs and snapshots with the given prefix.

trans-unit.source: You can export all blobs and snapshots in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: You can export all blobs and snapshots in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: For more information about specifying blobs to export, see the <link xlink:href="2f703ff1-d52b-43bd-81ec-90350a39e2af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Job</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: For more information about specifying blobs to export, see the <link xlink:href="2f703ff1-d52b-43bd-81ec-90350a39e2af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Job</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Obtaining Your Shipping Location
trans-unit.target: Obtaining Your Shipping Location

trans-unit.source: Before creating an export job, you need to obtain a shipping location name and address by calling the <link xlink:href="6260cd93-6c8e-4986-a2b6-a3c9df886ff6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Before creating an export job, you need to obtain a shipping location name and address by calling the <link xlink:href="6260cd93-6c8e-4986-a2b6-a3c9df886ff6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> will return a list of locations and their mailing addresses based on the location of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> will return a list of locations and their mailing addresses based on the location of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: You can select a location from the returned list and ship your hard drives to that address.
trans-unit.target: You can select a location from the returned list and ship your hard drives to that address.

trans-unit.source: Note that <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> may return only one possible shipping location.
trans-unit.target: Note that <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> may return only one possible shipping location.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to obtain the shipping location:
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to obtain the shipping location:

trans-unit.source: Identify the name of the location of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: Identify the name of the location of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: This value can be found under the <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> field on the storage account’s <embeddedLabel>Dashboard</embeddedLabel> in the management portal or queried for by using the service management API operation <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link>.
trans-unit.target: This value can be found under the <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> field on the storage account’s <embeddedLabel>Dashboard</embeddedLabel> in the management portal or queried for by using the service management API operation <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link>.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve a list of locations that are available to process this storage account by calling the <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> operation with the query parameter <codeInline>originlocation=%%amp;lt;location-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve a list of locations that are available to process this storage account by calling the <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> operation with the query parameter <codeInline>originlocation=%%amp;lt;location-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The list returned will contain one or more locations to which you can ship your drives.
trans-unit.target: The list returned will contain one or more locations to which you can ship your drives.

trans-unit.source: Select a location from the returned list and note its name and mailing address.
trans-unit.target: Select a location from the returned list and note its name and mailing address.

trans-unit.source: For the preview release, <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> will return one location, or none.
trans-unit.target: For the preview release, <languageKeyword>List Locations</languageKeyword> will return one location, or none.

trans-unit.source: If no locations are returned, the service is not yet available for your storage account.
trans-unit.target: If no locations are returned, the service is not yet available for your storage account.

trans-unit.source: Creating the Export Job
trans-unit.target: Creating the Export Job

trans-unit.source: To create the export job, call the <link xlink:href="2f703ff1-d52b-43bd-81ec-90350a39e2af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Job</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: To create the export job, call the <link xlink:href="2f703ff1-d52b-43bd-81ec-90350a39e2af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Job</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: You will need to provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: You will need to provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: A name for the job.
trans-unit.target: A name for the job.

trans-unit.source: The storage account name.
trans-unit.target: The storage account name.

trans-unit.source: The storage account key.
trans-unit.target: The storage account key.

trans-unit.source: The shipping location name, obtained in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: The shipping location name, obtained in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: A job type (Export).
trans-unit.target: A job type (Export).

trans-unit.source: The return address where the drives should be sent after the export job has completed.
trans-unit.target: The return address where the drives should be sent after the export job has completed.

trans-unit.source: The list of blobs (or blob prefixes) to be exported.
trans-unit.target: The list of blobs (or blob prefixes) to be exported.

trans-unit.source: Shipping Your Drives
trans-unit.target: Shipping Your Drives

trans-unit.source: Next, use the Azure Import/Export tool to determine the number of drives you need to send, based on the blobs you have selected to be exported and the drive size.
trans-unit.target: Next, use the Azure Import/Export tool to determine the number of drives you need to send, based on the blobs you have selected to be exported and the drive size.

trans-unit.source: See the <link xlink:href="f77535bb-d577-438a-bdd3-e15a82e0c543" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Import/Export Tool Reference</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <link xlink:href="f77535bb-d577-438a-bdd3-e15a82e0c543" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Import/Export Tool Reference</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Package the drives in a single package and ship them to the address obtained in the earlier step.
trans-unit.target: Package the drives in a single package and ship them to the address obtained in the earlier step.

trans-unit.source: Note the tracking number of your package for the next step.
trans-unit.target: Note the tracking number of your package for the next step.

trans-unit.source: You must ship your drives via a supported carrier service, which will provide a tracking number for your package.
trans-unit.target: You must ship your drives via a supported carrier service, which will provide a tracking number for your package.

trans-unit.source: Updating the Export Job with Your Package Information
trans-unit.target: Updating the Export Job with Your Package Information

trans-unit.source: After you have your tracking number, call the <link xlink:href="6f83d480-c09e-4e3b-b096-46e140e8c93d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Job Properties</link> operation to updated the carrier name and tracking number for the job.
trans-unit.target: After you have your tracking number, call the <link xlink:href="6f83d480-c09e-4e3b-b096-46e140e8c93d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Job Properties</link> operation to updated the carrier name and tracking number for the job.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally specify the number of drives, the return address, and the shipping date as well.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally specify the number of drives, the return address, and the shipping date as well.

trans-unit.source: Receiving the Package
trans-unit.target: Receiving the Package

trans-unit.source: After your export job has been processed, your drives will be returned to you with your encrypted data.
trans-unit.target: After your export job has been processed, your drives will be returned to you with your encrypted data.

trans-unit.source: You can retrieve the BitLocker key for each of the drives by calling the <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: You can retrieve the BitLocker key for each of the drives by calling the <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: You can then unlock the drive using the key.
trans-unit.target: You can then unlock the drive using the key.

trans-unit.source: The drive manifest file on each drive contains the list of files on the drive, as well as the original blob address for each file.
trans-unit.target: The drive manifest file on each drive contains the list of files on the drive, as well as the original blob address for each file.
